### box plot

```{r, boxplot}

   # --------------------------------------------------------------------------

renderPlot({
  
  A <- r1()$pp1
  B <- r1()$pp2
  
  m <- ceiling(max(A,B))
  mL <- floor(min(A,B))
  before <- A  
  after <-  B  
  n <- length(before)
  
  d <- data.frame(y = c(before, after), 
                  x = rep(c(1,2), each=n),
                  id = factor(rep(1:n,2)) #,
               #   r = 1
                  )
  
   
  # color dots 50:50 randomly
 # if(input$perc) {
  #    d$r <-  sample(1:2, n, replace=TRUE)
  #}
   
  d$xj <- jitter(d$x, amount=.13)

  AA <- ggplot(data=d, aes(y=y, colour=  ifelse (input$perc,     sample(1:2, n, replace=TRUE)      , 1)                 ) ) +
    geom_boxplot(aes(x=x, group=x), width=0.2, outlier.shape = NA, col='blue', fill='lightblue') +
    geom_point(aes(x=xj), size=2) +
    #scale_color_manual(values = c("1" = "purple", "0" = "orange")) +
    xlab("") + ylab("Response") +  
    scale_x_continuous(breaks=c(1,2), labels=c("Group 1", "Group 2"), limits=c(0.5, 2.5)) +
    theme_bw() + theme(legend.position = "none") 
  
  print(AA)
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

})
  # --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 

```

```{r  generate data}
 
   # --------------------------------------------------------------------------
   
    r1 <- reactive({
      
        # Dummy line to trigger off button-press
        foo <- input$resample
             
        L1 <-     input$mu0
        L2 <-     input$mu0+input$eff.p
        n <-      input$n
        sd. <-    input$sd.
        
        pp1 <- rnorm(n,L1, sd.)
        pp2 <- rnorm(n,L2, sd.)
    
    return(list(pp1=pp1, pp2=pp2 ))
    
    })
   
    # --------------------------------------------------------------------------

 
  
```
